metadata.name: SHA-256 Hash Function
metadata.description: Secure Hash Algorithm producing 256-bit (32-byte) hash values. Part of the SHA-2 family designed by NSA and standardized by NIST. Widely used for digital signatures, certificates, and blockchain.

metadata.name: RC4 Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Variable-key-size stream cipher widely used in the past but now considered insecure. Uses a secret internal state of 256 bytes with two 8-bit index pointers to generate a pseudo-random keystream.

specifications.name: RFC 6229: Test Vectors for the Stream Cipher RC4

metadata.name: A5/1 GSM Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Stream cipher used in GSM cellular networks for over-the-air communication privacy. Uses three irregularly clocked LFSRs with majority function clocking control.

officialTestVectors.description: ETSI A5/1 test vector with standard key

metadata.name: Salsa20 Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Fast and secure stream cipher designed by Daniel J. Bernstein using ARX operations. Part of the eSTREAM portfolio and uses 256-bit keys with 64-bit nonces.

references.name: The Salsa20 Family of Stream Ciphers

metadata.name: Trivium Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Hardware-oriented stream cipher using three nonlinear feedback shift registers. Part of the eSTREAM hardware portfolio and ISO/IEC 29192-3 standard.
metadata.inventor: Christophe De Cannière and Bart Preneel

references.name: Trivium: A Stream Cipher Construction (De Cannière-Preneel)

officialTestVectors.description: eSTREAM Trivium Set 1, Vector 0 (all-zeros key and IV)

results.name: Polybius

metadata.name: Polybius Square
metadata.description: Ancient coordinate-based cipher system that converts letters to coordinate pairs using a 5×5 grid. Forms the foundation for many advanced classical ciphers including Bifid, Trifid, and tap codes.

testVectors.description: Ancient Greek example - transmitted by torch signals

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: Trifid

metadata.name: Trifid Cipher
metadata.description: Advanced three-dimensional fractionating cipher that extends Bifid to use a 3×3×3 cube. Each character maps to three coordinates (layer, row, column), creating the first practical trigraphic substitution cipher.

references.name: Delastelle, F.: Traité Élémentaire de Cryptographie (1901)

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: Bifid

metadata.name: Bifid Cipher
metadata.description: Advanced fractionating cipher that combines Polybius square coordinate system with transposition. Each plaintext character is converted to coordinates, then coordinates are rearranged before recombining into ciphertext.

references.name: Delastelle, F.: Traité Élémentaire de Cryptographie (1901)

recommendations: Consider adding more test vectors for better coverage

results.name: Gronsfeld

metadata.name: Gronsfeld Cipher
metadata.description: Polyalphabetic substitution cipher using a repeating numeric key. Each digit represents a Caesar shift, making it a simpler variant of the Vigenère cipher with reduced key space.

testVectors.description: Traditional Gronsfeld example with simple numeric key

recommendations: Consider adding more test vectors for better coverage

results.name: Porta

metadata.name: Porta Cipher
metadata.description: Reciprocal polyalphabetic substitution cipher where the same operation both encrypts and decrypts. Uses a 13-row substitution tableau based on key letters, making it one of the first practical self-reciprocal ciphers.

references.name: Bellaso, G.B.: La Cifra del. Sig. Giovan Battista Belaso (1563)

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: Bazeries

metadata.name: Bazeries Cylinder Cipher
metadata.description: Mechanical transposition cipher using a cylindrical device with rotating disks. Text is written horizontally around the cylinder and read vertically, with disk alignment determined by the key.

references.name: Bazeries, É.: Les Chiffres Secrets Dévoilés (1891)

recommendations: Add source attribution to test vectors

results.name: CADAENUS

metadata.name: CADAENUS Cipher
metadata.description: Computer Aided Design of Encryption Algorithm - Non Uniform Substitution. A hybrid cipher system that combines multiple cryptographic techniques including position-dependent substitution and key-derived transformations.

recommendations: Add source attribution to test vectors

metadata.name: AES-GCM-SIV Nonce Misuse-Resistant AEAD
metadata.description: Nonce misuse-resistant authenticated encryption scheme based on AES and POLYVAL. Provides minimal information leakage when nonces are accidentally reused, making it safer than traditional AEAD schemes.

specifications.name: RFC 8452 - AES-GCM-SIV: Nonce Misuse-Resistant Authenticated Encryption

metadata.name: XSalsa20 Extended Nonce Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Extended variant of Salsa20 with 192-bit nonces designed by Daniel J. Bernstein. Provably secure if Salsa20 is secure, suitable for applications requiring longer nonces.

results.name: Caesar

metadata.name: Caesar Cipher
metadata.description: Classical substitution cipher where each letter is shifted by a fixed number of positions (traditionally 3) in the alphabet. One of the oldest and most well-known encryption techniques.

references.name: Suetonius: Lives of the Twelve Caesars

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: OCB3

metadata.name: OCB3 Offset Codebook Authenticated Encryption
metadata.description: High-performance single-pass authenticated encryption using offset values to ensure block cipher independence. Significantly faster than GCM while providing strong security guarantees.

references.name: OCB: A Block-Cipher Mode for Efficient Authenticated Encryption

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: ChaCha20

metadata.name: ChaCha20 Stream Cipher
metadata.description: Modern stream cipher designed by Daniel J. Bernstein as a variant of Salsa20 with improved diffusion. Uses 20 rounds of quarter-round operations and supports 256-bit keys with 96-bit nonces.

specifications.name: RFC 7539: ChaCha20 and Poly1305 for IETF Protocols
Bernstein: ChaCha, a variant of Salsa20

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: Autokey

metadata.name: Autokey Cipher
metadata.description: Enhanced polyalphabetic substitution cipher that extends the key using the plaintext itself, eliminating the periodic key repetition weakness of the basic Vigenère cipher.

references.name: Vigenère, B. de: Traicté des Chiffres (1586)

recommendations: Add source attribution to test vectors

results.name: ChaCha20-Poly1305

metadata.name: ChaCha20-Poly1305 AEAD
metadata.description: Authenticated encryption algorithm combining ChaCha20 stream cipher with Poly1305 MAC. Standardized in RFC 7539 and widely used in modern protocols like TLS 1.3 and WireGuard.

specifications.name: RFC 7539 - ChaCha20 and Poly1305 for IETF Protocols
RFC 7634 - ChaCha20, Poly1305, and their use in IKE

references.name: ChaCha20 and Poly1305 based Cipher Suites for TLS

warnings: Many test vectors lack proper attribution

results.name: AEGIS-128

metadata.name: AEGIS-128 High-Performance AEAD
metadata.description: High-performance authenticated encryption algorithm using AES round functions as building blocks. Designed for excellent performance on processors with AES-NI instruction support.

references.name: The AEGIS Family of Authenticated Encryption Algorithms

recommendations: Add source attribution to test vectors

results.name: ASCON-128

metadata.name: ASCON-128 Lightweight AEAD
metadata.description: NIST Lightweight Cryptography Standard designed for IoT and resource-constrained devices. Winner of CAESAR competition lightweight category with excellent performance on microcontrollers.
metadata.inventor: Christoph Dobraunig, Maria Eichlseder, Florian Mendel, Martin Schläffer

specifications.name: NIST SP 800-232 - ASCON Lightweight Cryptography Standard

results.name: BASE64

metadata.name: Base64 Encoding
metadata.description: Binary-to-text encoding scheme that represents binary data in ASCII string format using a radix-64 representation. Widely used in email, web protocols, and data serialization.
metadata.inventor: Originally in RFC 989, standardized in RFC 4648

specifications.name: RFC 4648: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings

metadata.name: AES-SIV Deterministic AEAD
metadata.description: Deterministic authenticated encryption using Synthetic Initialization Vector (SIV) mode. Provides nonce misuse resistance and deterministic encryption properties.

NIST SP 800-38F - Methods for Key Derivation and Data Protection

results.name: gimli-universal

metadata.name: Gimli Cryptographic Permutation
metadata.description: NIST Lightweight Cryptography finalist featuring a 384-bit permutation with exceptional simplicity. Uses only 3 operations (AND, XOR, rotate) making it perfect for educational purposes and understanding permutation-based cryptography.
metadata.inventor: Daniel J. Bernstein, Stefan Kölbl, Stefan Lucks, Pedro Maat Costa Massolino, Florian Mendel, Kashif Nawaz, Tobias Schneider, Peter Schwabe, François-Xavier Standaert, Yosuke Todo, Benoît Viguier
